intro: Asplundia longitepala, commonly known as the long-stemmed asplundia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and peace lilies. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and produces striking, spatulate-shaped leaves that are often brightly colored. Its inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe, typical of the Araceae family. Asplundia longitepala is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
